summary:
• The graduation ceremony takes place after a 50-year delay.
• A milestone event occurs 50 years late to its original schedule.
• Historic moment marks a significant occasion in Australian history.

• British Columbia has become the first Canadian province to decriminalize hard drugs in 2017
• However, the government is now considering reversing this decision
• The reversal comes after concerns were raised about the impact on public health and safety

• The cartoon cat is a popular character in China.
• It has been criticized by Chinese authorities due to its humor.
• As a result, the cartoonist is being targeted by censors.

• Police rule out political motive behind attack on Danish PM.
• Authorities investigate incident to ensure safety and security.
• Prime Minister's office confirms no political motivations were found.

• French President Emmanuel Macron is considering calling a snap election after suffering defeats in recent European polls.
• Macron views snap elections as an "act of trust" to regain public confidence.
• The European Parliament has shifted towards the right wing, leading to Macron's consideration of early elections.

• A massive lava flow has engulfed a road in Iceland.
• The volcanic eruption caused widespread destruction along the affected area.
• Emergency services were deployed to rescue stranded motorists and aid those impacted by the disaster.

• Narendra Modi sworn in for third term at grand ceremony in Delhi 
• Coalition to make Prime Minister Modi humble
• Sworn in as PM for third term with familiar allies

• The Irish government is fighting for dominance in local elections.
• Parties are competing to take the lead in these elections.
• The outcome will determine who controls the country's government.

• A father of an Israeli hostage was tragically killed the day before his son was rescued.
• Benny Gantz has quit the Israeli war cabinet due to disagreements with Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu.
• Four Israeli hostages were successfully rescued after being held captive in Gaza.

• The tragic death of a popular Nigerian actor has raised concerns about safety protocols in the entertainment industry.
• A Nigerian teenager was allegedly abducted by sextortion scammers who demanded a ransom from his family within six hours before he was found dead.
• As a result, the film industry is now reviewing its safety measures to prevent similar incidents in the future.

• The centre-right party is set to increase its majority in the European Union election.
• Far-right parties have made significant gains in the election.
• Michael Mosley's wife has paid tribute to her late husband, describing him as kind.

• Former President Trump will appear for a probation interview on Monday.
• A 100-year-old World War II veteran married his 96-year-old bride near the beaches where he fought during the war.
• The US has started sending aid back to Gaza again after fixing its damaged military pier.
